<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function registers a function to be called when the user &quot;interrupts&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the program (typically by pressing ctrl-c).  When the user interrupts the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// program, the specified interrupt function is called instead of the program</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// being killed, and the interrupt function automatically disabled.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that interrupt functions are not allowed to call any non-reentrant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// functions.  An null interrupt function pointer disables the current</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// installed function.  Note also that the handler may be executed on a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// different thread on some platforms.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a03a7c4c80c31a619c5e452314166401a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sys/#a03a7c4c80c31a619c5e452314166401a">SetInterruptFunction</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (&#42;IF)());</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Registers a function to be called when an &quot;info&quot; signal is delivered to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the process.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// On POSIX systems, this will be SIGUSR1; on systems that have it, SIGINFO</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// will also be used (typically ctrl-t).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that signal handlers are not allowed to call any non-reentrant</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Registers a function to be called in a &quot;one-shot&quot; manner when a pipe</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// signal is delivered to the process (i.e., on a failed write to a pipe).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// After the pipe signal is handled once, the handler is unregistered.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The LLVM signal handling code will not install any handler for the pipe</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// signal unless one is provided with this API (see \\ref</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DefaultOneShotPipeSignalHandler). This handler must be provided before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// any other LLVM signal handlers are installed: the \\ref InitLLVM</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// constructor has a flag that can simplify this setup.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Note that the handler is not allowed to call any non-reentrant</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// functions.  A null handler pointer disables the current installed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// function.  Note also that the handler may be executed on a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// different thread on some platforms.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This function does the following:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// - clean up any temporary files registered with RemoveFileOnSignal()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// - dump the callstack from the exception context</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// - call any relevant interrupt/signal handlers</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// - create a core/mini dump of the exception context whenever possible</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Context is a system-specific failure context: it is the signal type on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Unix; the ExceptionContext on Windows.</span></CodeLine>
